result of expression and constant have different datatypes; see CONSTR5

Test.Comment: ALTER-Statements do not contain all required keywords

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB304N_1 ( COL1 INT unique, COL2 CHAR(32), COL3 LONG, COL4 LONG, COL5 VARCHAR unique, COL6 CHAR, COL7 INT, PRIMARY KEY (COL1, COL7))

ALTER TAB304N_2 ADD (COL6 CHAR CONSTRAINT CONSTR29P_2 REFERENCES TAB304N_1 (COL5) ON DELETE SET)
ALTER TABLE TAB304N_2 ADD (COL7 CHAR CONSTRAINT CONSTR29P_3 REFERENCES TAB304N_1 (COL5) ON DELETE )
ALTER TABLE TAB304N_2 ADD (COL8 CHAR CONSTRAINT CONSTR29P_4 REFERENCES TAB304N_1 (COL5) ON )
ALTER TABLE TAB304N_2 ADD ( COL9 CHAR CONSTRAINT CONSTR29P_5 REFERENCES TAB304N_1 (COL5) CASCADE )
DROP TABLE TAB304N_1
DROP TABLE TAB304N_2

ALTER TABLE TAB305N_2 ADD ( COL8 DATE CONSTRAINT CONSTR305N REFERENCES TAB305N_2 )
DROP TABLE TAB305N_1
DROP TABLE TAB305N_2

Test.Comment: trying to delete a value that is referenced, if it does not work the CONSTRAINT seems to be added correctly

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB306N_1 ( COL1 INT unique, COL2 CHAR(32), COL3 LONG, COL4 LONG, COL5 VARCHAR unique, COL6 CHAR, COL7 INT )
CREATE TABLE TAB306N_2 ( COL1 INT, COL2 CHAR(32), COL3 NUMBER, COL4 LONG, COL5 DATE, COL6 CHAR, COL7 INT, PRIMARY KEY (COL3))
alter table tab306n_2 add (col8 int constraint constr306n_2 references tab306n_1 (col1))
insert into tab306n_1 (col1, col2) values (1, 'car')
insert into tab306n_1 (col1, col2) values (2, 'river')
insert into tab306n_1 (col1, col2) values (3, 'lawn')
insert into tab306n_2 (col3, col8) values (45, 1)
DELETE FROM TAB306N_1 WHERE COL1 = 1
SELECT COL1, COL2, COL3 FROM TAB306N_1
DROP TABLE TAB306N_1
DROP TABLE TAB306N_2

Test.Comment:
trying to rename a table by using invalid or incomplete table_names
(e.g. name is too long, name starts with _ or a number)

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB307N( COL1 CHAR(18), COL2 CHAR(4), COL3 CHARACTER(19), CONSTRAINT pk PRIMARY KEY ( COL1, COL2, COL3 ) )
RENAME TAB307N TO QQQQQIIIIIQQQQQIIIIIQQQQQIIIIIQII
RENAME TAB307N TO 1QQQQIIIIIQQQQQIIIIIQQQQQIIIII
RENAME TAB307N TO _QQQQIIIIIQQQQQIIIIIQQQQQIIIII
RENAME TAB307N TO 'QQQQIIIIIQQQQQIIIIIQQQQQIIIII
RENAME TAB307N TO Q-I
DROP TABLE TAB307N

Test.Comment: trying to RENAME a table with a used (and as a result occupied) table_name

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB308N_1 ( COL1 CHAR(32), COL2 CHAR(32), COL3 LONG, COL4 LONG, COL5 VARCHAR, COL6 VARCHAR, PRIMARY KEY (COL1))
CREATE TABLE TAB308N_2 ( COL1 NUMBER, COL2 NUMBER, COL3 FLOAT, COL4 FLOAT, COL5 INT, COL6 INT, PRIMARY KEY (COL2))
RENAME TAB308N_1 TO "TAB308N_2"
SELECT tablename, columnname, datatype FROM COLUMNS WHERE tablename IN ('TAB308N_1', 'TAB308N_2')
DROP TABLE TAB308N_1
DROP TABLE TAB308N_2

Test.Comment:
trying to use reserved keywords for tablenames when renaming them
<SAPDB problem> ** 7.3, 7.4.3 via RENAME it is possible to name a table "TABLE" PLANNED, SAP DB development

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB309N ( COL1 CHAR(18), COL2 CHAR(4), COL3 CHARACTER(19), CONSTRAINT pk PRIMARY KEY ( COL1, COL2, COL3 ) )
RENAME TAB309N TO TABLE
DROP TABLE TABLE
drop table tab309n

Test.Comment:
setting a primary key - constraint to NULL
-- test due to a known and fixed bug "alter table tab357 modify (col1 null)" did not bring up an error message, but didnt even set col1_constraint to null

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB357 ( COL1 INT, COL2 INTEGER, COL3 NUMBER(*), COL4 DATE, CONSTRAINT pk PRIMARY KEY ( COL1 ) )
INSERT INTO TAB357 (COL1) VALUES ( 1 )
ALTER TABLE TAB357 MODIFY (COL1 NULL )
DROP TABLE TAB357

Test.Comment: incomplete CONSTRAINT test has been created due to a known bug (incomplete constraints were accepted)

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB437 ( COL1 VARCHAR, COL2 INTEGER, COL3 FLOAT(32), COL4 FLOAT(29) )
ALTER TABLE TAB437 ADD (COL5 INT CONSTRAINT CONSTR1 )
DROP TABLE TAB437

Test.Comment: constraint before DEFAULT, see COL1

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB88 ( COL1 INT, COL2 FLOAT(21), COL3 CHAR(125), COL4 FLOAT(25), COL5 VARCHAR(1451), CONSTRAINT pk PRIMARY KEY ( COL3 ) )
ALTER TABLE TAB88 MODIFY ( COL1 NOT NULL DEFAULT 12 )
DROP TABLE TAB88

Test.Comment: missing keyword SET; duplicate "SET" and missing "NULL";

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB990N_1 ( COL1 VARCHAR(100) PRIMARY KEY, COL2 CHAR(11), COL3 NUMBER(2) NOT NULL, COL4 VARCHAR(100), COL5 VARCHAR, COL6 RAW(2000), COL7 INTEGER, COL8 NUMBER(38), COL9 DATE, COL10 LONG )

CREATE TABLE TAB990N_2 ( COL1 CHAR(100) PRIMARY KEY, COL2 CHAR(11), COL3 LONG NOT NULL, COL4 NUMBER(38), COL5 VARCHAR(100) REFERENCES TAB990N_1 ON DELETE NULL, COL6 RAW(2000), COL7 INTEGER, COL8 VARCHAR(100), COL9 DATE, COL10 NUMBER(2) )

CREATE TABLE TAB990N_3 ( COL1 CHAR(100) PRIMARY KEY, COL2 CHAR(11), COL3 LONG NOT NULL, COL4 NUMBER(38), COL5 VARCHAR(100) REFERENCES TAB990N_1 ON DELETE SET SET NULL, COL6 RAW(2000), COL7 INTEGER, COL8 VARCHAR(100), COL9 DATE, COL10 NUMBER(2) )
SELECT * FROM TABLE TAB990N_2
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM COLUMNS WHERE tablename='TAB990N_3'
DROP TABLE TAB990N_1

Test.Comment:
PRIMARY KEY constraint for LONG column - in a single statement; see COL9_CONSTR
** for DB < 7.4 there is another error-code see ALTER_TABLE_negative.xml[13]

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE TAB13 ( COL1 RAW(8), COL2 CHARACTER(48), COL3 VARCHAR2(17), COL4 FLOAT(13), COL5 FLOAT(22), COL6 VARCHAR2(63), COL7 DATE, COL8 VARCHAR(33) )
ALTER TABLE TAB13 ADD ( COL9 LONG CONSTRAINT COL9_CONSTR PRIMARY KEY )
DROP TABLE TAB13
